title: Pharmacy Vocabulary
description: Fill your prescription for knowledge with this quiz on pharmacy and pharmaceutical terminology.

questions.question: What does the abbreviation 'Rx' stand for in pharmacy?
options: A symbol derived from the Latin word 'recipe,' meaning 'take'

questions.question: What does 'compounding' mean in pharmacy?
options: Adding interest to a pharmacy bill
Custom-preparing medications by mixing individual ingredients to meet a patient's specific needs

questions.question: What does 'BID' mean on a prescription?
What is a 'formulary'?
options: A mathematical formula for drug dosages
A list of prescription drugs covered by a particular insurance plan

questions.question: What does 'contraindication' mean?
options: A condition or factor that makes a particular treatment inadvisable
A positive effect of a drug
A secondary use for a medication
A drug that requires a prescription

questions.question: What is a 'generic drug'?
options: A medication with the same active ingredients as a brand-name drug but typically sold at a lower price
A drug that treats general symptoms

questions.question: What does 'PRN' mean on a prescription label?
What is 'pharmacokinetics'?
options: The speed at which a pharmacy fills prescriptions
The study of how the body absorbs, distributes, metabolizes, and excretes drugs

questions.question: What does 'dispense' mean in pharmacy?
options: To prepare and provide medication to a patient according to a prescription

questions.question: What is an 'excipient'?
options: An inactive substance used as a carrier for the active ingredient in a medication

questions.question: What does 'QD' mean on a prescription?
What is 'bioavailability'?
options: The shelf life of a medication
Whether a drug is available at the pharmacy
The proportion of a drug that enters the bloodstream and has an active effect

questions.question: What does 'titration' mean in pharmacy?
options: Gradually adjusting the dose of a medication to find the optimal amount

questions.question: What is a 'drug interaction'?
options: A situation where one drug affects the activity of another when both are taken together
A side effect from a single medication

questions.question: What does 'over-the-counter' (OTC) mean?
options: A medication available for purchase without a prescription
An expired drug returned to the counter
A drug passed over the pharmacy counter by a pharmacist
A drug sold only at a doctor's office
